Logging decoratorÂ¶

Suite of decorator for logging.

logging_decorator.err_lambda_logger(level, *, start=None, end=None, err=None, log_err=True)Â¶

Decorator for logging before and after function execution. Decorated function must be method in class with logger attribute. Log with exception level if decorated func raise an exception.

Parameters:
  • level (str) â€“ level of logger.
  • start (func) â€“ string to log before function exec, default: None.
  • end (func) â€“ string to log after function exec, default: None.
  • err (func) â€“ string to log if exception is raised, default: None.
  • log_err (bool) â€“ log error if True, default: True.

Logging filtersÂ¶

Custom filters for logging

class logging_filters.LvlFilter(low, high)Â¶

Custom filter based on level.

filter(record)Â¶

Determine if the specified record is to be logged.

Is the specified record to be logged? Returns 0 for no, nonzero for yes. If deemed appropriate, the record may be modified in-place.

Logging levelÂ¶

Custom level for logging.

class logging_level.LoggingLevelÂ¶

Custom logging level. All method are static so they can dynamically inherit from the logger they are used by.

Attr dict name_to_level:
 static dict to define reference between name and level.
